Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 30 points including a jumper with three-tenths of a second left to secure the win for the Cavaliers.
Damian Lillard had a brilliant performance with 41 points and nine assists, shooting 10 of 15 from 3-point range.
Giannis Antetokounmpo contributed 34 points, 16 rebounds, and nine assists for the Bucks.
Lillard put Milwaukee ahead with a step-back jumper with 9.8 seconds remaining.
Mitchell regained possession after briefly losing control and hit a 19-footer to win the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are one win away from matching their best start in franchise history, having won their first eight games in 1976-77.
Milwaukee has lost five straight games since winning its opener.
The Bucks played without Khris Middleton, who is recovering from surgery on his ankles.
The teams will meet again on Monday in Cleveland.
